In the sequence of numbers 1, 3, 2, ... each term after the first two is equal to the term preceding it minus the term preceding that.  The sum of the first one hundred terms of the sequence is\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 5 \qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ 4 \qquad 
\textbf{(C)}\ 2 \qquad 
\textbf{(D)}\ 1 \qquad 
\textbf{(E)}\ -1$
